Given the ongoing spread & rebound of the virus, the priority remains to be stepping up equitable distribution of COVID-19 vaccines and enhancing solidarity&cooperation. Origin-tracing cooperation must be based on science, and politicization must be firmly rejected.

Virus knows no borders&does not distinguish between races. China, like other countries, is a victim of the pandemic, and we all hope to find out the origin and cut off its transmission as early as possible.

Very importantly, the plan for origin-tracing involving a particular country must be decided through consultation with the country concerned, as it provides the basis for effective cooperation to be conducted.

Third, China has all along supported and will continue to take part in science-based origin-tracing efforts. What China opposes is politicizing origin-tracing, or origin-tracing that goes against the WHA resolution and disregards the joint study report.

Second, the findings&recommendations of the WHO-China joint study report are widely recognized by the int’l community&scientists, and must be respected&implemented by all parties, including WHO. The future work of global origin-tracing should&must proceed from that basis.

First, origin-tracing is a matter of science. No country has the right to put its own political interests above people's lives, nor should a matter of science be politicized for the purpose of slandering and attacking other countries.

Today, the Chinese Ministry of Foreign Affairs Holds Briefing on COVID-19 Origin-Tracing for Diplomatic Envoys in China, Vice Foreign Minister Ma Zhaoxu elaborated China's position on global origin-tracing. Pls read the official press release: https://t.co/NXjBE8phkJ https://t.co/IQKdJxfWZ7
